newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's BPI only candidate for BFE.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's BPI only candidate for BFE.

text.p: Banco Portugues de Investimento was the only candidate for the state's 65 percent stake in Banco de Fomento & Exterior whose bid was approved by the selecting jury, Finance Minister Antonio Sousa Franco said on Thursday.
"The recommendation of the jury was that the only proposal to pass to the final phase was that of BPI", Sousa Franco told a news conference.
It was not immediately known how much BPI had bid for Banco Fomento because the envelopes containing the value of the offer had not yet been opened.
The other candidates were Banco Finantia, in alliance with Swiss Bank Corp, and Banco Nacional de Credito Imobiliario, controlled by cork magnate Americo Amorim.
Shares in Banco de Fomento were suspended on Thursday at 2,545 escudos ($16.6) ahead of the news conference.
No details were immediately available on the reasons for the decision of the jury, set up to examine the privatisation proposals.
